gr.forth.ics.jbenchy
Class Aggregate

java.lang.Object
  gr.forth.ics.jbenchy.Aggregate

public abstract class Aggregate
extends java.lang.Object

Aggregate functions that can be applied to coalesce multiple values into a single result.

Author:
andreou

Method Summary

          The average of the values of the given variable.

abstract  DataType getResultType(Schema schema)
          Returns the type of the expected result of this aggregation, in regards to the given schema.
abstract  java.lang.String getVariableName()
          Returns name of the variable involved in this aggregate (or a dummy alias in case of a "count", which takes no variable).

toSql

public abstract java.lang.String toSql()
Returns the SQL representation of an aggregation. Examples: "AVG(SALARY)", MIN(TIME), COUNT(*) etc.

getVariableName

public abstract java.lang.String getVariableName()
Returns name of the variable involved in this aggregate (or a dummy alias in case of a "count", which takes no variable).

getResultType

public abstract DataType getResultType(Schema schema)
Returns the type of the expected result of this aggregation, in regards to the given schema.

Parameters:
schema - the schema which will be used to resolve the type of a possible variable that this aggregation may contain
